title: Nvidia Issues Muted Outlook as Videogaming Business Slows
description: The chip maker reported a sharp decline in quarterly sales, driven by waning consumer demand for its videogaming chips.

title: Amazon Confirms Corporate Job Cuts That Could Hit 10,000 Employees
description: Amazon said it is laying off employees across its corporate ranks, in a rare round of cuts for a tech giant that has mostly seen consistent growth throughout its history.

title: Micron to Cut Production of Memory Chips
description: The company said it expects production starts of wafers for the two major types of memory chips to be about 20% lower than in the recently ended quarter.

title: Musk Tells Twitter Staff to Work 'Long Hours at High Intensity' or Leave
description: Staffers have a Thursday deadline to stay or take a severance package.

title: Artemis I Mission Has Smooth Start After Historic Launch
description: NASA officials said the moon rocket has performed well so far during its inaugural test flight.

title: FTX's Collapse Leaves Employees Sick With Anger
description: What started as a dream job turned into a nightmare for employees of the crypto exchange that imploded in spectacular fashion last week.

title: Facebook Parent Meta Sees Executive Exodus in India
description: Three senior Meta executives in India have left the company in recent weeks, and the company is changing the office’s reporting structure amid a broad global restructuring.

title: Musk to Take Stand in Trial Over His Tesla Compensation Package
description: Elon Musk is slated to take the stand in a shareholder lawsuit over his multibillion-dollar compensation package at Tesla.

title: Buffett-Backed Electric-Car Giant BYD Halts Spinoff of Chip Unit
description: The company said it instead plans to accelerate investments in expanding its chip-making capacity, building on a recent investment in a chip factory in eastern China.

title: Tencent Revenue Drops as Videogame, Online Ad Businesses Struggle
description: Tencent’s revenue declined for a second consecutive quarter as China’s slowing economy dented videogame user spending and the marketing budgets of digital advertisers.

title: Israel's OurCrowd to Launch AI Business in U.A.E.
description: The venture-capital firm is partnering with Abu Dhabi entity to invest $60 million to expand its operations in the Arab country.

title: Microsoft Announces New Harassment Policies in Response to Internal Review
description: Microsoft announced enhanced policies it said are meant to prevent sexual harassment and gender discrimination, in response to an independent review that outlined areas for improvement.

title: Berkshire Hathaway Bets Big on Taiwanese Chip Maker
description: Warren Buffett’s investment in Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing marks the latest step into an industry that he had shied away from for much of his career.

title: Elon Musk Delays Introduction of Twitter's Blue Verification to Nov. 29
description: New rollout target follows suspension of updated subscription service after impersonators swarmed the platform.
